page.title: 03FARM NAMES
page.content: The following farms are now being farmed in this area. Clint Hall Farm, Church Farm, Nidd House Farm, Home Farm,Scarah Bank Farm, High Rails Farm, Bridge End Farm,Crag Hill Farm, Whipley Bank Farm, High House Farm, Clint Grange Farm. All these farms are between Two hundred and Eight hundred acres. The smallest farm is not listed above, being owned by a Mr. E. Norton, and is about one hundred acres. All these farms specialise in milking cows, bullocks being sold off.The crops grown are associated with cattle feed being mainly grass for hay and silage, but some turnips, barley and corn are also grown. Some land is given over to grazing.
